artist: Designer: Brenner Thornton; Manufacturer: Goblin Teasmade
creditline: Gift of funds from various donors, by exchange
description: light tan body with clock on front; white porcelain teapot with square body; chrome tea kettle with square body; entire assembly rests on tan tray
dimension: 10 3/4 x 16 3/4 x 17 3/16 in. (27.31 x 42.55 x 43.66 cm) (without power cord)
inscription:
Inscription
On clock face, in black: [GOBLIN/ (symbol)/ MADE IN U.K.]; on bottom of pot, in green: [GOBLIN/ Teas- (jumping goblin) made/ MADE IN ENGLAND/ A]
medium: Melamine, earthenware, chrome and other metals, rubber, cardboard, electrical components
text: Responding to the English fondness for tea, William Thornton made a patent application for an automatic tea maker in 1933. Named Teasmade, it sounded an alarm clock, turned on the lights, boiled water and brewed a pot of tea at your bedside. As advertised in England in 1954, Teasmade “means a cheery, cozy cup of freshly made tea in bed everyday of the year.”
title: "Cheerywake" tea server
